1.text: The wisdom of women buildeth their house; but folly plucketh it down with her hands.

2.text: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth Jehovah; but he that is perverted in his ways despiseth him.

3.text: In the fool’s mouth is a rod of pride; but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

4.text: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean; but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

5.text: A faithful witness will not lie; but a false witness uttereth lies.

6.text: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and there is none [for him]; but knowledge is easy unto the intelligent.

7.text: Go from the presence of a foolish man, in whom thou perceivest not the lips of knowledge.

8.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to discern his way; but the folly of the foolish is deceit.

9.text: Fools make a mock at trespass; but for the upright there is favour.

10.text: The heart knoweth its own bitterness, and a stranger doth not intermeddle with its joy.

11.text: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown; but the tent of the upright shall flourish.

12.text: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof is the ways of death.

13.text: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful, and the end of mirth is sadness.

14.text: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways, and the good man from what is in himself.

15.text: The simple believeth every word; but the prudent [man] heedeth his going.

16.text: A wise [man] feareth and departeth from evil; but the foolish is overbearing and confident.

17.text: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly, and a man of mischievous devices is hated.

18.text: The simple inherit folly; but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

19.text: The evil bow before the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous [man].

20.text: He that is poor is hated even of his own neighbour; but the rich hath many friends.

21.text: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth; but he that is gracious to the afflicted, happy is he.

22.text: Do they not err that devise evil? but loving-kindness and truth are for those that devise good.

23.text: In all labour there is profit; but the talk of the lips [tendeth] only to want.

24.text: The crown of the wise is their riches; the folly of the foolish is folly.

25.text: A true witness delivereth souls; but deceit uttereth lies.

26.text: In the fear of Jehovah is strong confidence, and his children shall have a place of refuge.

27.text: The fear of Jehovah is a fountain of life, to turn away from the snares of death.

28.text: In the multitude of people is the king’s glory; but in the lack of people is the ruin of a prince.

29.text: He that is slow to anger is of great understanding; but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.

30.text: A sound heart is the life of the flesh; but envy the rottenness of the bones.

31.text: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker; but he that honoureth Him is gracious to the needy.

32.text: The wicked is driven away by his evil-doing; but the righteous trusteth, [even] in his death.

33.text: Wisdom resteth in the heart of the intelligent [man]; but that which is in the foolish maketh itself known.

34.text: Righteousness exalteth a nation; but sin is a reproach to peoples.

35.text: The king’s favour is toward a wise servant; but his wrath is [against] him that causeth shame.
